resources.string: Look! There are 4 pizza-cooking tasks for you !
As we know, there are two work centers :
What we need to do firstly is to classify these pizza into 2 groups like this.
Next , we need to sort each group BUT by different order.
Look at Group 1 , we need to focus on their\t
So we sort them in Ascending order of their preparing time.
And , we need to sort Group 1 but in contrary way.
Look at Group 2, we need to focus on their
So we sort them in Descending order of their baking time.
Finally, just combiner the ordered group 1 and the ordered group 2.
So, your final cooking time is :
to come back to your game,
and you will see a key
, click it to find out the best solution!

This application is copyrighted by École Polytechnique de l\’Université de Tours, Laboratory LIFAT (Laboratoire d\’Informatique Fondamentale et Appliquée de Tours), Team ROOT (Recherche Opérationnelle : Ordonnancement et Transport), as well as the final interpretation right.
Directed By : ROBBES Alexis (alexis.robbes@univ-tours.fr), CHEVROTON Hugo (hugo.chevroton@univ-tours.fr)

This application is proposed by Mr.ROBBES Alexis and Mr.CHEVROTON Hugo, as the Research \u0026 Development project for JIANG Yaqi, fifth year student during 2019-2020 in École Polytechnique de l\’Université de Tours.

This application is only applied in education or scientific research for École Polytechnique de l\’Université de Tours, which is forbidden for private use in any commercial purposes, and also forbidden to copy our ideas.
Thank you for your interest in our application.If you have any questions or suggestions, please contact us by email.
There are many icons used in our application from www.flaticon.com
UK Flag, France Flag : all these Icons made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com

Oven, Tomate (in board), Cheese (in board), key, Open-Book, Menu : all these icons made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com 
Pizza (in board) : Icon made by xnimrodx from www.flaticon.com 
Alarm: Icon made by itim2101 from www.flaticon.com
Check: Icon made by Kiranshastry from www.flaticon.com
Right-arrow: Icon made by smashicons from www.flaticon.com \nConfused: Icon made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com
There are some icons made by ourselves
Logo of application : designed and made by JIANG Yaqi. \nNew-Game, Title-Board (Flowshop-pizza) : icons made by JIANG Yaqi.

Operations Research (OR) is an analytical method of problem solving and decision making useful in the management of organizations. In operations research, problems are broken down into basic components and then solved by steps defined by mathematical analysis. For example, the knapsack problem models an analogous situation of filling a backpack. The bag cannot support more than a certain amount of weight. This bag is filled with all or part of a given set of items each having a weight and a value. The sum of the objects put in the backpack must be as large as possible, without exceeding the maximum authorized weight. An application could invite people to introduce operations research, and help them better understand the definition and resolution methods used in this discipline.

Scheduling theory is a branch of operations research that is concerned with calculating optimal completion dates for tasks. For this, it is very often necessary to simultaneously allocate the necessary resources to perform these tasks. A scheduling problem can be thought of as a scheduling subproblem in which it is a matter of deciding on the operational execution of scheduled tasks.\nFlow shop scheduling problems, are a class of scheduling problems with a workshop in which the flow control shall enable an appropriate sequencing for each job and for processing on a set of machines or with other resources 1,2,...,m in compliance with given processing orders. \n(via https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flow_shop_scheduling)

The University of Tours, is a decisively European university that has established a campaign of actions within the Europe 2020 strategy, aiming to develop “smart, sustainable and inclusive growth”. Through its higher education and research missions, the University of Tours plays a key role in research, development and in raising the scientific, cultural and professional capacities of as many individuals as possible. \nWebsite : https://www.univ-tours.fr

Polytech Tours, (École Polytechnique de l\’Université de Tours) is the graduate school of engineering of the University of Tours, it is also a member of the Polytech network. The Polytech network is a network of 14 schools of engineering of French universities that graduate each year more than 3,000 engineers. This makes the Polytech network the biggest engineering graduates schools network in France. 
Polytech Tours offers five engineering specialties: Electrical Energy Systems, Computer Science, Industrial Computing, Mechanics and Systems design, Urban and Territorial Planning and Environment. And they hosts 270 students in its preparatory course, 850 students in the engineering specialties and 90 students in the PhD course. 
(via https://polytech.univ-tours.fr/english-version/presentation) 
Website : https://polytech.univ-tours.fr

LIFAT, Laboratoire d’Informatique Fondamentale et Appliquée de Tours, There are 48 faculty members (Professors, Assistant professors), 25 PhD candidates, 7 PhD post-docs in the Laboratory of Fundamental and Applied Computer Science of Tours (french acronym: LIFAT), The lab is actually organized in three research groups: DataBases and Natural Language Processing (french acronym: BdTln), Operations Research, Scheduling, and Transportation (french acronym: ROOT), Pattern Recognition and Image Analysis (french acronym: RFAI).

ROOT : Team Recherche Opérationnelle : Ordonnancement et Transport \n The operations research, scheduling, and transportation team (ROOT for its acronym in French) was founded in 1986 under the name “Ordonnancement et Conduite” (OC). Today, the team’s main research interests include the design, development, and application of operations research techniques to: production and project planning and scheduling, high performance computing and big data, and transportation science and logistics. The team sets a special focus on multi-agent, multi-objective, stochastic, and robust approaches. ROOT brings together 12 faculties, 8 Ph.D. students, 2 post-doctoral fellow, and a number of master’s students who conduct high-quality and internationally renowned research. \n(via https://lifat.univ-tours.fr/lifat-english-version/teams/root)

RFAI : Team Reconnaissance des formes et analyse d\'images \n. The Pattern Recognition and Image Analysis team (in french, RFAI, for Reconnaissance des Formes et Analyse d\'Images) focuses on machine learning, data mining and image processing. It conducts research on methods allowing to construct and exploit high-semantic level representations from various input data. \n(via http://www.rfai.lifat.univ-tours.fr)

BdTln : Team de Bases de données et Traitement des langues naturelles
 
Research conducted at the Databases and Natural Language Processing (in French, BdTln, for Bases de Données et Traitement de Langage Naturel) team covers a big variety of challenges concerning unstructured, semi-structured and structured data. The team is composed of 4 full professors, 11 associate professors (4 having an Habilitation à diriger des recherches) and 7 PhD students. 
(via https://lifat.univ-tours.fr/lifat-english-version/teams/bdtin)
